answers.answer: Dear Kakujala_99,I would recommend that you seek the care of an eyeMD and have your eyes dilated to check for any retinal issues which might occur with floaters as well as a cycloplegic refraction, to determine your prescription in your eyes without straining.Dr. FeldmanSandy T. Feldman, M.D., M.S.ClearView Eye and Laser Medical CenterSan Diego, California

question: About a year ago i needed to get glasses. I have trouble seeing things at a distance. Sometimes my vision is more blurry than other times. I have already been evaluated for diabetes. I am wondering of maybe I might be deficient in something?? I am also seeing floaters. Please help! Thanks.
title: blurred vision that comes and goes at times
